item.title: About Me
item.description: My name is Ryan Guide. I lived in Pittsburgh until I turned 4, then I moved to State College where I currently live. In 2016 I attended Allegheny College, where I graduated with a bachelor’s degree in mathematics in 2020. As the pandemic shut down the world, I began looking into new paths to follow. In the summer of 2021, I met with Dr. Patrick McDaniel, and joined the SIIS Lab.
item.content: My name is Ryan Guide. I lived in Pittsburgh until I turned 4, then I moved to State College where I currently live. In 2016 I attended Allegheny College, where I graduated with a bachelor’s degree in mathematics in 2020. As the pandemic shut down the world, I began looking into new paths to follow. In the summer of 2021, I met with Dr. Patrick McDaniel, and joined the SIIS Lab. Ever since then I have been working on my Master’s degree at Penn State University. I am graduating December 2022.

item.title: Research
item.description: My research was on the characterization of SIDS rules through modifications. Once the paper is published, it will be posted on this website as well. Publication is currently pending.
item.content: My research was on the characterization of SIDS rules through modifications. Once the paper is published, it will be posted on this website as well. Publication is currently pending.

item.title: Socials
item.description: You can find me on any of the socials below. For the fastest response, use the email listed on my resume. LinkedIn Twitter GitHub Resume

item.title: Projects
item.description: As I finish projects I will post links to them here. My first project (pending release) is a Python package.
item.content: As I finish projects I will post links to them here. My first project (pending release) is a Python package.
